English.Text: The locals are stubborn in their silence. The Queen is a relative of those who own the land they work, and they fear for their livelihoods. There are further confirmations that the Queen passed through however, which lead you to the unlikely environs of a cider orchard. Two likely-looking pickers stand at the gate, both unable to disguise that they have recently met royalty, or that they have promised to say nothing to that matter.
